Jun 2, 2003

dictating sentences to federal judges

> Under the new law, Congress has “taken the unprecedented step” of dictating to federal judges what sentences must be imposed. Since 1986, when the U.S. Sentencing Commission was established, that role has belonged to the Commission. Talk Left has a good discussion of why that is wrong.
